segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the type and function of the message and to transmit the identifying number.
DTM, A segment to indicate date(s) and time(s) applying to the whole message.
FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable supplementary information. In computer-to-computer exchanges free form text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.
GEI, A segment to provide a general indicator relating to the whole message, such as urgency.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to specify the document or message to which the current message relates, and related date and time.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to identify a reference which applies to the entire message, e.g. reference to previous message.
DTM, A segment to indicate date and time relating to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to identify the routing and date of the schedule or availability information.

segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to identify a location, e.g. place of departure/arrival.
DTM, A segment to indicate date(s) and time(s) related to the location.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to define requested or available equipment.

segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to specify requested or available equipment and equipment size and type.
EQN, A segment to specify the number of requested or available pieces of equipment.
MEA, A segment to specify measurements, other than dimensions, associated with equipment, in terms of capacity.
DIM, A segment to specify dimensions applicable to equipment.
FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable supplementary information associated with the equipment.
RFF, A segment to specify a reference number to equipment.
TPL, Segment to specify the link between the means of transport and the equipment.
DTM, A segment to indicate date(s) and time(s), e.g. earliest departure date/time, latest arrival date/time.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to specify the schedule or availability selection criteria and to detail the schedule or availability information being provided.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to indicate information related to the mode and means of transport, eg. specific conveyance/carrier.
DTM, A segment to indicate date(s) and time(s), e.g. earliest departure date/time, latest arrival date/time.
TSR, A segment to identify contract, conditions of carriage, services and priority requirements.
RFF, A segment to provide a reference related to the transport details, such as the published line or route number.
FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable supplementary information related to the means of transport.
EQD, A segment to identify the equipment requested/available.
QTY, A segment to indicate a quantity, e.g. number of intermediate stops.
MEA, A segment to indicate weight and/or volume selection criteria, e.g. minimum weight.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to identify the routing(s) and indicate corresponding date(s) and time(s).

segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to identify a location, e.g. place of departure/arrival.
RFF, A segment to provide a reference related to the location, such as the platform number at the place of departure.
FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable information related to the location including consignments to be accepted from a port of loading.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A segment group to indicate date(s) and time(s) related to the location, e.g. date/time of schedule or expected departure/arrival and additional information e.g. reason for delay

segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to indicate date(s) and time(s) related to the location, e.g. date/time of schedule or expected departure/arrival
FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable information related to the date including reason for delay.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments to indicate all parties involved in the transaction and relevant locations, contacts and communication channels.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the party's name, address and function.
LOC, A segment to identify a place/location/sub-location and where relevant the function. The present location must be associated with the relevant party.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments to identify a contact and its communication channels, related to the party.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department within a party.
COM, A segment to identify the communication numbers of person or department to whom communication should be directed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments to describe the goods items for which schedule or availability is requested/provided.

segment.documentation: GID, A segment to identify the goods item. A goods item can be identified by up to three levels of packaging within this segment.
HAN, A segment to specify handling instructions relating to the goods item.
FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable information relating to the goods item.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments to identify and describe the goods.

segment.documentation: GDS, A segment to describe the nature of cargo.
FTX, A segment to describe the goods in free form.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments to specify measurements applicable to the goods item.

segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to specify measurements, other than dimensions, applicable to the goods item.
EQN, A segment to specify the number of equipment units to which the measurement applies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments to specify dimensions applicable to the goods item.

segment.documentation: DIM, A segment to specify dimensions applicable to the goods item.
EQN, A segment to specify the number of equipment units to which the given dimensions apply.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments to specify dangerous goods details related to the goods item.

segment.documentation: DGS, A segment to specify the class of dangerous goods, packing group, etc.
FTX, A segment to specify the dangerous goods technical name and any other additional dangerous goods information.
DTM, A segment to indicate date(s) and time(s), e.g. Earliest departure date/time, latest arrival date/time.
